confab.options¶

confab.options.options = {'should_render': <function _should_render at 0x1036fe1b8>, 'get_environmentname': <function _get_environmentname at 0x1036fe488>, 'assume_yes': False, 'get_rolename': <function _get_rolename at 0x1036fe410>, 'is_empty': <function _is_empty at 0x1036fe230>, 'get_hostname': <function _get_hostname at 0x1036fe398>, 'diff': <function _diff at 0x1036fe500>, 'get_mime_type': <function _get_mime_type at 0x1036fe320>, 'filter_func': <function _is_not_temporary at 0x1036fe2a8>}¶

Dictionary subclass enabling attribute lookup/assignment of keys/values.

For example:

>>> m = _AttributeDict({'foo': 'bar'})
>>> m.foo
'bar'
>>> m.foo = 'not bar'
>>> m['foo']
'not bar'

_AttributeDict objects also provide .first() which acts like .get() but accepts multiple keys as arguments, and returns the value of the first hit, e.g.:

>>> m = _AttributeDict({'foo': 'bar', 'biz': 'baz'})
>>> m.first('wrong', 'incorrect', 'foo', 'biz')
'bar'
class confab.options.Options(**kwargs)[source]¶

Context manager to temporarily set options.

confab.options.assume_yes()[source]¶

Set the option to assume_yes in other tasks.
